CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Kristina Pardalos;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant was taken into police custody in GPE on suspicion of aiding and abetting an illegal organisation , namely the ORG ( ORG Party ) . During his police custody , the applicant signed a form explaining arrested persons ' rights , whereby he was reminded of his right to remain silent . On DATE the police officers interrogated the applicant at the Anti - Terrorism department of ORG , in the absence of a lawyer . The applicant admitted that he had aided and abetted the ORG and acted as courier for the organisation . Another accused , GPE was also arrested in the course of the operation . In his police statement , GPE stated that he was a member of the ORG and that he had stayed at the applicant 's house when he had come to GPE and maintained that the applicant had acted as a ORG courier and helped him in certain illegal activities .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was questioned by the public prosecutor and he denied that he had been involved in the ORG . He also claimed that he had signed his police statement without reading it .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant was brought before the investigating judge , who questioned him and CARDINAL other suspects in relation to their involvement in the ORG . The applicant 's lawyer was also present during the questioning . In his statement to the investigating judge , the applicant denied all the charges against him . After the interrogation , the applicant was placed in pre - trial detention on the order of the judge .

CARDINAL . In an indictment dated DATE , ORG at ORG charged the applicant and CARDINAL others with aiding and abetting an illegal organisation . The charges were brought under LAW and LAW no . ORG ( the anti - terrorist law ) .

CARDINAL . During the trial , the applicant denied any connection with the ORG . Furthermore GPE , CARDINAL of the co - defendants , admitted to being a ORG member before the court , but stated that although he had stayed at the applicant 's house when he had come to GPE , the applicant did not know that he was a ORG member . In this connection , GPE rejected his police statement , alleging that it had been taken under duress . On DATE ORG convicted the applicant as charged and sentenced him to DATE and DATE imprisonment . In convicting the applicant , ORG relied on the applicant 's police statement , which had been taken in the absence of a lawyer . The court further took into consideration the police statement of GPE who had given evidence that the applicant had been involved in the activities of the ORG . It therefore concluded that the applicant 's police statement , in which he had admitted to his involvement in the ORG , had been confirmed by other evidence in the case file .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal .
